page.title: 06Farming in St. Levan (2)
page.content: {DAIRY FARMING}is now highly{organised {and intensive,}60 milking cows plus followers now being kept on one forty hectare farm (Trewey) where 30 was the norm thirty years earlier. Other farms have{changed to beef or pig production (Chywidden and Raftra){due to EEC {economic pressures}on dairy farming through quota restraints. {CASH CROPS. Potatoes,}sent to markets 'up country' as a vegetable{are the {main anciliary cashcrop.}At Bosistow they are harvested in bulk for use in a potato crisp factory.{Spring Cabbage {and Broccoli are the other main crops; horticulture is a minor activity and some Narcissi are grown but cannot match the early flowers of the Isles of Scilly or Channel Islands. All cashcrops tend to be a gamble on the state of the market and the weather.
